trans-unit.source: Call a custom API from a Windows Store client - Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Call a custom API from a Windows Store client - Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Learn how to define a custom API and then call it from a Windows Store app that use Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to define a custom API and then call it from a Windows Store app that use Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Call a custom API from the client
trans-unit.target: Call a custom API from the client

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to call a custom API from a Windows Store app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to call a custom API from a Windows Store app.

trans-unit.source: A custom API enables you to define custom endpoints that expose server functionality that does not map to an insert, update, delete, or read operation.
trans-unit.target: A custom API enables you to define custom endpoints that expose server functionality that does not map to an insert, update, delete, or read operation.

trans-unit.source: By using a custom API, you can have more control over messaging, including reading and setting HTTP message headers and defining a message body format other than JSON.
trans-unit.target: By using a custom API, you can have more control over messaging, including reading and setting HTTP message headers and defining a message body format other than JSON.

trans-unit.source: The custom API created in this topic gives you the ability to send a single POST request that sets the completed flag to true for all the todo items in the table.
trans-unit.target: The custom API created in this topic gives you the ability to send a single POST request that sets the completed flag to true for all the todo items in the table.

trans-unit.source: Without this custom API, the client would have to send individual requests to update the flag for each todo item in the table.
trans-unit.target: Without this custom API, the client would have to send individual requests to update the flag for each todo item in the table.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete [Get started with Mobile Services] or [Add Mobile Services to an existing app].
trans-unit.target: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete [Get started with Mobile Services] or [Add Mobile Services to an existing app].

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Update the app to call the custom API
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Update the app to call the custom API

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: This topic showed how to use the InvokeApiAsync method to call a fairly simple custom API from your Windows Store app.
trans-unit.target: This topic showed how to use the InvokeApiAsync method to call a fairly simple custom API from your Windows Store app.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about using the InvokeApiAsync method, see the post Custom API in Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about using the InvokeApiAsync method, see the post Custom API in Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Also, consider finding out more about the following Mobile Services topics:
trans-unit.target: Also, consider finding out more about the following Mobile Services topics:

trans-unit.source: [Define a custom API that supports periodic notifications]
trans-unit.target: [Define a custom API that supports periodic notifications]

trans-unit.source: <html></html>Learn how to use a custom API to support periodic notifications in a Windows Store app.
trans-unit.target: <html></html>Learn how to use a custom API to support periodic notifications in a Windows Store app.

trans-unit.source: With period notifications enabled, Windows will periodically access your custom API endpoint and use the returned XML, in a tile-specific format, to update the app tile on start menu.
trans-unit.target: With period notifications enabled, Windows will periodically access your custom API endpoint and use the returned XML, in a tile-specific format, to update the app tile on start menu.

trans-unit.target: [Mobile Services server script reference]

trans-unit.source: <html></html>Learn more about creating custom APIs.
trans-unit.target: <html></html>Learn more about creating custom APIs.

trans-unit.source: [Store server scripts in source control]
trans-unit.target: [Store server scripts in source control]

trans-unit.source: <html></html> Learn how to use the source control feature to more easily and securely develop and publish custom API script code.
trans-unit.target: <html></html> Learn how to use the source control feature to more easily and securely develop and publish custom API script code.
